intro: Maesa elongata, commonly known as the elongated maesa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a leathery texture. Maesa elongata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
